etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From methyl + malonic, after German Methylmalonsäure methylmalonic acid

definitions: "methylmalonic acid" noun a dicarboxylic acid isomeric with succinic acid, (CH₃)CH(COOH)₂.
"methylmalonic aciduria" noun the presence of an abnormally large amount of methylmalonic acid in the urine, especially as a manifestation of an inborn error of metabolism; an instance of this.
"methylmalonic acidaemia" noun any of several inherited metabolic disorders characterized by the presence of an abnormally large quantity of methylmalonic acid in the blood and urine.
